ygData.subject: Re: attacking the alliance
ygData.msgSnippet: There can be a dropoff at the beach, theres already been to many posts about my troops taking cover to redo all the posts so it s easier to make something up

There can be a dropoff at the beach, theres already been to many posts about
my troops taking cover to redo all the posts so it's easier to make
something up as we go along (If you want to change that use defenses either
in the water or around the beach, or boobytrap the dropoff, remote mines are
always a nice touch.)

Sorry, missed that part of the post. I thought they were still at the CF.

Astral flies into the battle, firing twenty shots at Prebon.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Prebon continues to fall back, as the shots hit his armor, It seemed that he
had underestimated the alliances forces. They still had a chance, so far
there were only about two- one odds, not much of a challenge for a team as
skilled as the Trainers. Each member was programed for leadership, each knew
thier places. He knew that the alliance weren't as invincible as they had
claimed. This attack was never meant as a conquering assault, it was meant
to take the measure of Alliance technology. So far it was as he thought,
they were up against typical Predacon technology, Since it was typical it
could be defeated. Prebon fired five shots from his constrictor rifle at
Astral and two missles at Fenox.


Fenox flies in behind her leader, firing several bolts at Blaze.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Blaze spread out away from Prebon, the only way to defeat an enemy like the
alliance was to take them on directly. If her team let the alliance troops
gather together they'd have a major strategic advantage,. If they could keep
the enemy off gaurd they could force them to act unpredictably. She fealt a
sudden breeze from behind her, she turned and saw Fenox making his move. She
fired five shots from her disruptor disabling some of the bolts and
continuing at Fenox. Bolts rained down on her like the weather during a
plasma storm. She curled into a defensive position and put an energy shield
above her, it wasn't designed to cover her entire body so some of the bolts
snuck through striking her in the legs. The bolts wouldn't do much damage to
her legs unless she let them continue to strike her.


Starlight glides into the battle, firing three darts (with
tranquilizer) at Bullet.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Bullets body was built to strong for the darts causing them to bounce off
harmlessly. If the alliance was to do damage to the bot that turned into a
bull they'd have to use something a little stronger. "What is this, Make me
angry day? To bad you'll have to try a little harder." The horns on top of
his head glowed and fired a force bolt at Starlight.
Griplash flies/falls with stile into the scene, firing two missiles
at Iguanus.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Iron Fist's defences keep firing.

(What are the defenses and puick a target,)

Hammer moved forward when a blaster targeted him, the bot hadn't scanned far
enough ahead to detect it. The shot hit the ground in front of him sending
him backward. Another shot hit next to him, if he didn't know better he'd
think he was being herded somewhere. (Hows that for a hint?)




----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 28, 2000 10:44 PM
Subject: Re: attacking the alliance


> Where would you find limited cover? The only thing for miles around
> is the ocean. I don't think waves offer too good a protection.
>
> Also, please don't post damage for my ship. It'll take alot more than
> what you're firing right now to weaken the shields to any really
> noticable. Remember, it took 30 Alliance bots over a week (real time)
> of battle to take down the Cybertronian Fire's shields, and the Iron
> Fist is stronger than the Cybertronian Fire.
>
> One last thing, please post for my Lavacons attacking your troops.
>
> ::Zardus/Havoc/Astral/Fenox/Starlight/Griplash/Recklessa/Slayer::
>
> The shots fired by the Trainers hit the shields, Zardus laughing. He
> loved this Predacon technology. Zardus fires back at Prebon with
> three shots from his plasma launcher.
>
> "Yes, it appears the Mighty Zardus has," he says, "Although I'd be
> interested to know why you are attacking my base."
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Slayer and Recklessa plunge into the water, both trying to get at
> each other. The underwater defences of the Iron Fist begin to
> activate.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Havoc smiles as the shots from Bullet's disruptor are intercepted by
> the shields. The shields let things out, but they didn't let them in.
>
> Havoc fires two missiles at Bullet, still laughing.
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> The Lavacons continue to fire at the Trainers.
>
>
>
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > OK Yanshosh, since theres already been posts involving cover I'll
> say
> > limited cover. As for distance, they're supposedly a superior race
> three
> > miles is nothing to thier main weapons.
> >
> > Bullet looks up, seeing havok, The missles head toward him faster
> than he
> > can react. Suddenly the missles explode in mid air as a burst of
> energy
> > strikes them down. Blaze stands, disruptor in hand awaiting further
> attacks.
> > She aims at Hovok firing three shots from her disruptor.
> >
> > Ignatius joins Slayer in his attempts to bring down Wheeljack. he
> fires his
> > eyebeams at the Alliance bot, and two missles at the shields
> covering the
> > power unit.
> >
> > Hammer rises again and fires an energy beam across the battlefield,
> moving
> > back and forth at Sharpedge and Godfather.
> >
> > "We're taking abuse here" Hammer calls out. With the limited cover
> he didn't
> > feel such a small unit could be much effect.
> >
> > Prebon believed differently though as he continued to push for
> advancement,
> > the disruptorblasts were doing thier job and weakening the shields
> but it
> > still wasn't fast enough. "Continue the advance, so far theres been
> little
> > resistance, as long as they can't call for reinforcements we have
> the upper
> > hand." Prebons inspirational words pushed the Trainers forward with
> the need
> > for success or deleation. Failure was not a possability or an
> option.
